info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 30 at 3:03PM MDT until July 31 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible.
* WHERE...A portion of east central New Mexico, including the following county, Curry County.
* WHEN...Through late tonight.
* IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A disturbance is expected to continue to produce thunderstorms with heavy rain this afternoon through tonight. A few of the stronger storms will be capable of producing torrential rainfall at rates near 2 inches per hour. Urban areas and locations with repeated bouts of thunderstorms will be favored for rapid runoff and flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT
